turn.1: What was the Canadian Automobile Machine Gun Brigade?
turn.2: Canadian Automobile Machine Gun Brigade The Canadian Automobile Machine Gun Brigade, also known as Brutinel's Brigade or the Brutinel Brigade, was the first fully motorized unit of the Canadian Army.
turn.4: It was established on August 24, 1914 in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada, as Automobile Machine Gun Brigade No. 1 by Canadian Brigadier-General Raymond Brutinel, who initiated the program and was the unit's first commander.
turn.5: What role did it play in the war?
turn.6: The unit played a significant part in halting the major German Spring Offensive of March 1918.
turn.7: What else did you find interesting about it?
turn.8: The Brigade was originally equipped with eight Armoured Autocars mounting two Colt Model 1914 machine guns (later replaced with the standard British Vickers MG) manufactured by Autocar in Ardmore, Pennsylvania.
turn.10: Autocar also supplied six unarmoured support vehicles, four "roadsters" for the Brigade's officers, and an ambulance.
turn.11: Did it receive any recognition or awards?
turn.12: Field Marshal Sir Douglas Haig wrote that the "work of the 1st CMMG Brigade in recent operations has proved the value that can be obtained from such units, and recommends the formation of a 2nd Brigade be undertaken forthwith." So in May 1918 the 2nd Canadian Motor MG Brigade was added.
